name: molybdenum trioxide production | molybdenum trioxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10931/documentation

This dataset represents the production of molybdenum trioxide by roasting of molybdenum sulfide ore (molybdenite) in air. This is a rough estimation created from published reasearch data and includes raw material and energy inputs for conversion reaction only. This dataset should be replaced as soon as better data are available.

Production process starting with the raw molybdenum sulfide.

This activity ends with the production of molybdenum trioxide from roasting in air. 
This dataset includes raw materials and energy inputs for conversion reaction. 
This dataset only includes sulfur dioxide air emissions. From molybdenite roasting.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Dataset is representive of the global region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technique for the world. The infrastructure was assumed to be the same as for blast furnace.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Stochiometric calculation of input (molybdenite or MoS) related to output (molybdenum trioxide).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on litterature, from McHugh F. L. et al. (2008), The sulfide ore looping oxidation process: an alternative to current roasting and smelting practice. Journal of the minerals, metals and materials society. 60 (7), p. 84-87.

exchanges.description: Literature value. Based on technical grade. Assumed impurities to have little effect on molar mass,

flow.name: molybdenum trioxide
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

exchanges.description: Stochiometric relation. Based on reaction of MoS2 to MoO3.

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. Represents energy requirements for roasting and scrubbing operation to produce molybdenum trioxide. Value was reported in kcal/kg of Mo, thus conversion to mass of MoO3 produced was necessary (McHugh, L.F., et al. 2008).
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Represents emissions from roasting of MoS2 based on stochiometry and assuming 93% efficiency of wet scrubbers (alkali) as reported by Environment Australia (1999). 

Environment Australia (1999), Emission estimation technique manual for sewage and biomedical waste incineration, National pollutant inventory, 37p. http://www2.unitar.org/cwm/publications/cbl/prtr/pdf/cat5/Australia_incineration.pdf
